October 10, 1946. 467 p.    U408.3.A13 FM 21-6 Oct. 1946    “This manual supersedes FM 21-6, 10 July 1946.”, 4074=The War Department, which became the Department of the Army in 1947, issued three major classes of publications -- administrative, doctrinal training and organizational, and technical and equipment publications. Administrative publications include publications such as Army Regulations, Special Regulations, Bulletins, Circulars, General and Special Orders, and Pamphlets; doctrinal, training and organizational publications contain Field Manuals, Army Training and Evaluation Programs, Training Circulars, Tables of Organization and Equipment, and Tables of Allowances; and technical and equipment publications include publications such as Technical Manuals, Technical Bulletins, Supply Manuals, etc. The Library of Congress does not have a complete set of these publications, but its holdings are extensive and significant., 19424=U. S. War Dept. Field manual. List and index of War Department publications. May 10, 1945. 386 p.    U408.3.A13 FM 21-6 May 1945    “This manual supersedes FM 21-6, 20 March 1945 and War Department Pamphlet 12-6, 1 April 1945.”, 7275=Army manuals also included a number of so-called "enemy" manuals. They are manuals -- which are official US Army publications -- concerning enemy equipment or forces. The letter "E" in the manual number indicates that a particular manual is an "enemy" manual. For example, Technical Manual TM E9-803 on the German Volkswagen appears just after Technical Manual TM 9-803 on the Jeep..  A number of "enemy" manuals about foreign forces are included, like TM E30-420, Handbook of the Italian Military Forces. The publication of "enemy" manuals was authorized by Section II, "Processing of Captured Materiel for Intelligence Purposes,” of War Department Training Circular 81, 6 November 1942., 16950=1941 U. S. War Dept. Basic field manual. List of publications for training. September 1, 1941. 128 p.    U408.3.A13 FM 21-6b Sept. 1941, 17147=1942 U. S. War Dept. Basic field manual. July 1, 1942. 263 p.    U408.3.A13 FM 21-6 July 1942, 9741=For a list of Technical Manuals issued as PB reports please see the excellent compilation, Army Manuals Listed in the Bibliography of Scientific and Industrial Reports, 1946-1949, compiled by Robert L. Bolin, University of Nebraska-Lincoln. It is available at http://www.unl.edu/Bolin_resources/bsir/Army%20Manuals%20Listed%20in%20BSIR,%201946-49.htm. The BSIR itself is available at http://www.unl.edu/Bolin_resources/bsir-xml/. This index lists those Army manuals by manual number and gives references to the citations in BSIR. Appendices also list the manuals by title and by PB-number.  Technical Manuals can also be identified in "Government Reports Announcements & Index" and through the "National Technical Information Service" which grew out of the Publications Board. , 150260=Compiled by Brian Horowitz January 2011, 12039=FAX orders to the Library of Congress, Duplication Services at:    (202) 707-1771    or mail your orders to:    Library of Congress    Duplication Service    Washington, DC 20540, 21310=U. S. Dept. of the Army. Field manual. List and index of Department of the Army publications. October 10, 1947. 520 p.    U408.3.A13 FM 21-6 Oct. 1947    “This manual supersedes FM 21-6, 10 July 1947.”, 9515=More than 2,000 U. S. Army manuals were listed in BSIR from 1946 into 1949. This finding aid lists those Army manuals and, where known, give the alternative PB or other number by which they can be found on microfiche., 19978=1946 U. S. War Dept. Field manual. List and index of War Department Publications. January 10, 1946. 469 p.    U408.3.A13 FM 21-6 Jan. 1946    “This manual supersedes FM 21-6, 10 October 1945.”, 21891=U. S. Dept of the Army. Field manual. List and index of Department of the Army publications. April 10, 1948. 528 p.    U408.3.A13 FM 21-6 Apr. 1948    “This manual supersedes FM 21-6, 10 January 1948.”, 12746=Field Manuals (FM) and Technical Manuals (TM) within the Library of Congress collections were classed as the serial title United States. Dept. of the Army. Training Publication (see bibliographic record below). As such these items do not have catalog records, hence the need for the inventory, but instead are accessed through the Library of Congress Call number U408.3.A13 followed by a subseries number and date. For example Air Navigation TM 1-205 would be requested as U. S. Dept. of the Army. Training publication U408.3.A13 TM 1-205 Nov. 1940. As the Library of Congress may have more than one version of a manual the month and date is a very important identifier., 13461=United States. Dept. of the Army. Training publication. Washington, U. S. Govt. Print. Off., 19uu- .    U408.3.A13    War Dept. publications pertaining to training have been issued in the form of Field service regulations, Field manuals, Technical manuals, Technical regulations, Training manuals, and Training regulations.    In January, 1940, numbers were assigned to Field service regulations and Field manuals from 1 to 1000 (FM), to Technical regulations from 1000 to 2000 (TR), to Training manuals from 2000 to 3000 (TM); and Training regulations were eliminated.    In April, 1940, Technical regulations and Training manuals were consolidated in the series of Technical manuals, and a new system of numbering was adopted.    The number of each pamphlet will consist of two parts: the basic number and subnumber. The basic numbers will be as follows: 1--Air Corps. 2--Cavalry. 3--Chemical Warfare Service. 4--Coast Artillery Corps. 5--Corps of Engineers. 6--Field Artillery. 7--Infantry. 8--Medical Department. 9--Ordnance Department. 10--Quartermaster Corps. 11--Signal Corps. 12--Adjutant General's Department. 13--Inspector General's Department. 14--Finance Department. 15--Judge Advocate General's Department. 16--Chaplains. 20 to 30--Basic field manuals. 100--Field service regulations. 101--Staff officers' field manual. 105--Umpire manual.    The subnumbers for Field manuals will be from 1 to 199 and for Technical manuals 200, etc. ... Field manuals and Technical manuals will ordinarily be referred to by number only, e.g., FM 6-110 or TM 4-235. -- War Dept. Circular no. 36, April 6, 1940.    Issued 19 - July 1947 by the War Dept., 19010=1945 U. S. War Dept. Field manual. List of publications for training. Field manuals, firing tables, lubrication orders, mobilization training program, technical bulletins, technical manuals, training circulars. textBeforeTable: SERIES 12. ADJUTANT GENERAL’S DEPARTMENT. INVENTORY OF TECHNICAL MANUALS Field Manual, FM 21-6, List and index of War Department publications. Technical Manuals and other War Department and Department of the Army publications were identified in FM 21-6 List and index of publications (title varies). Of these the Library of Congress has identified the following issues in its collections, by date. 1940 U. S. War Dept. Basic field manual. List of publications for training. 1940. 48 p.    U408.3.A13 FM 21-6a 1940 1941 U. S. War Dept. Basic field manual. List of publications for training. July 1, 1942. 263 p.    U408.3.A13 FM 21-6 July 1942 1944 U. S. War Dept. Field manual. List of publications for training.
